newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end with hefty losses,financials weak.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end with hefty losses,financials weak.

text.p: Tokyo stocks ended Wednesday trade with hefty losses brought on by continued selling of financial sector shares and profit-taking of some bellwether issues which had rallied on Tuesday, brokers said.
The 225-share Nikkei average finished 318.33 points or 1.77 percent lower at 17,703.37. Its June futures shed 330 points to close at 17,710.

"The basic trend remains unchanged," said Kunihiro Hatae, general manager at Tokyo Securities Co Ltd. "Banks, brokerages and construction sectors were being sold and some export-strong shares, encouraged by the weak yen, were bought."
